title.narrative: Community Assets Building for Livelihoods and Environmental Sustainability for Mindanao (Cables - Mindinao)

description.narrative: A total of 591 original families in many remote villages and tribal areas of the Caraga region in Mindanao will benefit from this project. In five years, these original partner families shall get 297 water buffalo, 92 beef cattle, 970 goats, 377 pigs, 1750 chickens, 80 ducks, 13400 fish fingerlings and 2400 crablets. The project’s values-based holistic intervention will assist these families to evolve into learning and helping communities with sustained income, food, and livelihood. By increasing their assets, target groups will be empowered to exert control over their lives, manage their resources effectively and participate meaningfully in community building. Families will be provided with Cornerstones training, livestock, tools, equipment, planting materials and facilities to develop sustainable farming systems that integrate livestock, crops and other enterprises. They will be assisted in forming community group savings scheme that will allow every member’s participation. In addition, participants will receive series of trainings and learning activities to improve skills and capacity to manage and sustain their projects. Each project group will have a trained animal health worker to ensure delivery of key services in animal breeding, veterinary care and protection. Other agencies will be mobilized to provide basic health and sanitation services. The project will likewise promote values-based and gender equity practices to enhance cooperation, sharing or resources and women participation. Additional 1031 families will benefit through passing on the gift within the project period.
